geninfo.para: Many alternators used in International vehicles are self-energizing and may require that the engine be revved before they will begin charging. They will then charge at idle. If the vehicle is going to be warmed up prior to beginning operation, the driver should observe the voltmeter or ammeter for charging indication before leaving the vehicle.

para.title: INTERNATIONAL 7.3 AND DT ENGINES WITH DELCO 21-SI ALTERNATORS

geninfo.para: These engines should be briefly revved to a minimum of 850 rpm when used with the Delco 21SI 65 and 100 amp alternators. For the 115 and 145 amp alternators, the engine should be briefly revved to a minimum of 1000 rpm. Alternator output at idle will vary greatly depending on idle speed. Idle speed should be checked periodically to be sure it is within specifications. Idle speed for the International 7.3 diesel engine is 675 rpm. Idle speed for the International DT diesel engines is 650 rpm, plus or minus 50 rpm. Setting the idle speed at the upper limit will significantly increase the alternator output at idle. On vehicles with Allison automatic transmissions, idle speed must be set with the transmission in the normal forward drive gear.
